components.description:
A round white and orange or red ring buoy with string laced through its perimeter. Also called a life preserver.

Maybe be used to talk about water, boats, and safety. May also be used metaphorically to talk about someone or something that saves.
components.title: Ring Buoy

version.description:
Unicode 14.0 is the version of the Unicode Standard released on September 14, 2021. 37 new emoji code points were added in this release, with all 112 new emojis (including sequences for skin tones) listed under Emoji 14.0.

New emojis added in this release are update expected to come to major platforms in either late 2021 or early 2022.

This release of this Unicode Standard was delayed from March 2021 due to COVID-19. 

  • üìù Unicode 14.0 details on Unicode.org

apple_vendor_description: The ring buoy emoji on Apple devices presents a vibrant, circular flotation device, typically rendered in a bright, cheerful red or orange with crisp white accents. Apple‚Äôs design imbues it with a subtle, glossy sheen and soft, rounded edges, giving it a tangible, almost buoyant feel. This emoji commonly symbolizes safety, rescue, vacation, or a need for help, adding a visual cue for situations requiring support or a change of fortune in messages.
